Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2011 04:22AM martygra wrote: Great news!  Take good care.
Posts.Title: Thank You All! Good News! Charlene40 meme31

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2011 03:28AM martygra wrote: I totally feel for you Amy,  I had my biopsy last Tuesday and am waiting for results.  I pretty much have imagined myself in the surgery scenario you painted for yourself at the end of your post.  The lump I discovered feels so giant to me and I am 54 so have been on the edge and sometimes over the edge since finding it 5 weeks ago.  I hope all turns out well for you.  I know for myself I can't take anymore of living with this fear.  I have even considered other options which are to scary to even mention although I would never have the courage to do anything like that. Prayers to you.
Posts.Title: emotional roller coaster... AmyR Lavender250

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2011 04:24AM martygra wrote: Hi Amy,  I was sure that you made a typo on that one!  I will be praying that you get B9 results as well.  I just cannot wait for a day when every minute of it is not thinking about this.  Best wishes to you!
Posts.Title: emotional roller coaster... AmyR Lavender250

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2011 08:39PM martygra wrote: My mood is terrible at the moment, feeling suicidal.  I go for chemo class at 8:00 AM tomorrow.  Port surgery at 10:00.  Echo test Tuesay am at 6:45, start chemo Friday.  That is if this fear does not kill me first.  I have wasted probably the last weekend I will feel good for a long time being unable to even function,  did not even take a shower or brush my teeth today.  I don't know how I am ever going to be able to hold up to this.  Wishing you all the best.
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2011 06:13PM martygra wrote: Hi,  Sounds like Tappy and Stjude10 and I are on the same program except my first treatment is tomorrow.  I DO NOT WANT TO DO THIS!  That is all I keep thinking.  I am so worried about the whole thing,  not reallly worried that it is not going to work just worried about all the side effects and worried that it may damage my otherwise heathy body with all this crap we have to take.  I will also have to have rads and aromatase inhibitor for 5 years, dont' know what yet.  I have not had surgery yet,  my dr. hopes chemo will shrink the tumor so will be able to conserve more of the breast, what about you ladies?  I am also going to have to try and work through it all.  I am divorced and single so what are you suppose to do when you have to pay the bills.  I am just praying that I will be able to function and my body and brain will work enough to get myself to work and do my job.  My job is not physical just mental, kind of stressful at times.  Production environment,  gotta meet deadlines and all that jazz.  I am a planner in a production plant which seems to have gotten quite busy lately even with the economy.  I will try and let you know how things go for me after my treatment.  I have been obsessed with all this lately and am hoping I will back off from dwelling on it so much.  My poor dogs and everything else is suffering as all I seem to do is read posts lately.  Some give me hope others not so much.  Hope all will go well for all us us,  still in disbelief at this point.  I will go and do what they tell me to do and hope for the best,  just can't wait to put this whole mess behind me.
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2011 05:08PM martygra wrote: Thank you all for you well wishes, hope you are all doing well too.  I am trying to stay positive.  I do know people mean well,  I have been one of them before this,  I did not know what to say when I heard someone say "I have breast cancer"  all I could say is I am so sorry,  and if it was someone close to me I would cry for them,  could not help myself.  I have always been a cry baby anyway which does not help especially now.  I just wish we could fast forward through all of this and get our lives back to normal.  One day this too shall pass I keep telling myself.....  Hugs to all of you!
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2011 08:07PM martygra wrote: Good luck to you too.  I have no doubt we will win,  I just hope we can make it through the treatment without to much distress.  Have a good night,  I am afraid to go to sleep but that is the only time my mind gets a break but the sooner I go to sleep the sooner it is tomorrow.
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 12:20PM martygra wrote: Hi Surreygirl,  I did take a claritin about an hour before my shot at 9:30.  I was wondering if I was suppose to take more so will with your info will take 1 today and tomorrow.  No pain so far.  I was a little worried because I read other places on the internet that said it had to be Claritin-D.  I went to the drug store and could not find Claritin-D on the shelf just the regular Claritin.  I asked the pharmacist and she said you had to have a perscription in Oregon to get the D.  So all I have is the regular Claritin, so far no pain but I don't know how long that takes to set in.  Sorry you got sick,  I don;t know what decadron is but so far I have not gotten sick (knock on wood) from anything,  I am hungry and food still tastes like food,  am I normal?  I don't want to start feeling to confident because I know the tables could turn at any time but so far I am good.
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2011 07:36PM martygra wrote: Hi Carla,  I did not talk to the dr, about anti depressents today.  I may later.  I had the port installed today under anesteshia,  I am feeling a bit sore,  took a vicodan and am going to bed shortly,  not much sleep last night and have to be up by 5:00 a.m. tomorrow.  Took the chemo class today, just can't wait to get started, hah right.  At least everyone I know friends and family, lady teaching the chemo class and all say they cannot imagine what I am feeling instead of just telling me to be strong and stay positive,  I say no you cannot imagine these feelings until you are there (and hopefully none of them will have to be) at least they realize that no they do not know how I feel they can only imagine how I feel.   Wishing you all the best, sleep well,  I am hoping I do,  I think I only got 3 hours last night.

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 09:45AM martygra wrote: Sorry you are so freaked out and I can definitly relate, it is very scary.  I can tell you that I had a lump biopsied and it took a week for me to get the results.  I was told from the start it was very suspicious so was pretty sure it was cancer and it was.   In your case it sounds like you have all good reason to believe that it is B9.  I think it was good of you to have it checked out sooner rather then later in the off chance it is something it is much better to find out sooner then later.  Best wishes for a happy outcome.

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 03:19AM martygra wrote: Thank you.  I found out I have IDC, grade between 2&3, non invasive, positive for estrogen, negative for her2, tumor is 3 cm.  She said it is slow growing and I have probably had for 2 to 3  years.  Now all the testing starts.  I will start with chemo to hopefully shrink it.  I guess this is not the worst report a person can get but I am still scared to death.  Glad you are all doing well and thanks again.
Posts.Title: Off to the doctor today. martygra martygra

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 01:25PM martygra wrote: Thanks much yet again.  I went for the MRI this morning.  I was to be there at 9;30, hospital was running behind,  appointment was to at 10:00, they did not get me in until 11:00.  It was alot more involved then thought, did  not think it would that  long, not fun.  I did not get out of there until 12:15.  I have to be there at 7:00 in the morning  tomorrow for the centinal node biopsy.  I sure hope they do not keep me there waiting around for that long for that or I will be a basket case for sure in the morning.  Do they put you under for that?  I am wondering as they told me to have nothing to eat or drink after midnight tonight so I am assuming they put you under.  I am hoping so.  Please let me know what I can expect, I would appreciate it.

Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 04:52AM martygra wrote: I had my first AC infusion yesterday,  they had me down for 41/2 was relieved to only be there 21/2.  So far I have been ok, kind of a little problem thinking and maybe a little aware of my heart but other then that nothing.  I have not felt any nausea either so far.  They did have anti nausea in my iv so I do not know how long that lasts but I too took one of the first ones a few hours after I got home and 1 of the lorzepan(spelling)before I went to bed.  I got about 7 hours of sleep.  I was having foot cramps which I have had before this in my right foot,  I was having those in both feet last night so do not know if it related to the chemo.  This morning I go for the Nuelesta shot and will have to take a steroid pill for 3 days.  So hard to keep track of all these pills and appts. I told the nurse that I had read that those Nuelesta shots caused alot of bone pain and that I had heard clartin helped with that.  She says yes she had heard that to so she said go ahead and try taking one it couldn't hurt.  I am going to my wig fitting on Thursday,  the hair issue is going to be quite hard on me, hopefully I will not cry for to long.  Hope we all continue on with minimal sides but I for one am not letting my guard down!  Take care
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 07:50AM martygra wrote: surreygirl,  My treatment ended at 1:30 yesterday and I have had no nausea or headache.  I have taken a couple of the anti nausea pills they sent me home with just as a precautionary measure don't want to give it a chance.  I am kind of worried about the Nuelesta shot this morning as I hear alot of ladies have bad bone pain.  I have to start steroid pills for 3 days also this morning.  I will be all wired up on those but won't be able to move because of the bone pain!  Hah, hopefully that won't be the case,  I hope to get some housework done today.  Have a good weekend everyone.
Posts.Title: October 2011 Chemo group stjude10 cfdr

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2011 10:05AM martygra wrote: Thanks for checking on me WhiteRabbit.  All I know is they found cancer in 2 nodes so I am told.  They said it was stage II.  I will be calling dr. Monday.  I have not been sore or anything, they gave me a prescription for Vicodan, which I have never liked how they make me feel.  Have taken a couple of aleave,  that is  kind of just in case but other that no problems.  Just can't wait for all this to be behind me.  So tired of not being myself.  I don't even want to take my clothes off and take a shower this morning.  I did not wake up with any drains under my arm which dr. had told me would happen in they had to remove any so I am hoping that is a good thing.  Hope you are doing well. Thanks again.

Posts.Title: Off to the doctor today. martygra martygra

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2011 12:54PM martygra wrote: Thanks Lee Ann,  It is a big elephant isn't it.  Do you know when you will be starting your chemo yet?  You sound like you handling things well, hope so.  Been doing alot of stressing about the financial impact too.  I have insurance but even with what they pay it is mind boggling to watch the dollars add up.  Just to much to deal with at this time.  Not much choice though.  I am so sorry for your diagnosis also.  I hope everyone is right about feeling better once you get going on a treatment plan,  I can't imagine being able to take this stress to much longer without losing it.  ((HUGS BACK AT YOU))
Posts.Title: Off to the doctor today. martygra martygra

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2011 06:03PM martygra wrote: I went to see the oncologist today,  found out I have to have 8 rounds of chemo,  go once every two weeks for 16 weeks,  then I am told I will have to have radiation because I had positive nodes, then I think she said some sort of estrogen after that.  I was so freaked out I did not even remember what kind of chemo she said,  she said 4 sessions of one type then 4 of another.  Things are moving way to fast now.  I have chemo class on Monday at 8:00, port put in at 12:00 on Monday and echo on Tuesday morning at 6:45 a.m..  I did not realize that the port placement was a surgery and you were put under anesthesia for it.  I had planned on going back to work after that but now I find out I cannot have anything to drink even water and the surgery is not until noon.  I will have to have a driver.  I am using up my vacation time like crazy to cover all this time off.  17 hours last week,  4 and a half this week, and will have to use another 10 or so next week.  The oncologist acted surprised today when I said I planned on working thorough chemo..  I have to earn a living so I can pay my regular bills let alone all these extra doctor bills.  She says you may not feel well and you may be tired.  Please let me hear from you women who have worked through chemo.  I still do not have all my stats,  all  I know is stage 2, grade 2 & 3, positive for estrogen, neg. her2, 3.2 cm.  I also found out I will have to have radiation.  2 positve nodes.  My first chemo will be 9/30, exactly 2 months since I found the lump.  I think she said the first type of chemo I will be getting starts with an A.  I wish I would have had someone with me to listen and write stuff down this time.  Thank you
Posts.Title: Off to the doctor today. martygra martygra

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2011 11:22AM martygra wrote: Thank you both for your replies,  I keep telling myself lots of other women have gone through this, it is still unbelieveable to me that there are so many, did not realize until finding out I had it myself.  So very sad that people have to go through this fear and sadness.  So sorry Susan that yours came back,  I can't imagine how awful that must feel.  I will pray for you and all the other women going through this.  I have been reading postive breast cancer survivor stories all morning trying to build myself up to get through this,  so far not helping alot.  I have a real problem with hearing what the doctors say.  They say do you have any questions and I can't think of any,  I HAVE NEVER HAD CANCER BEFORE, what do I ask???  Trying not to get to far ahead of myself and just take one day at a time, if that is possible.  So many many fears.  Do not know what to do.  I am freaking out about the losing of my hair,  do not know how I am going to handle that,  just know so many other women have gone before me. Trying to be postive and sending postive thoughts to you all.  What choice do we have but to do what we need to do and hopefully come out on the other side right side up.
Posts.Title: Off to the doctor today. martygra martygra

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2011 05:02AM martygra wrote: Thank you for your reply Mks16.  I don't think my managers would have a problem with email but one never knows.  I just don't want to have a break down in front of them and then have to run out of there and everyone looking at me wondering what the heck is going on.
Posts.Title: Off to the doctor today. martygra martygra

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2011 08:02AM martygra wrote: Well I did it,  I sent the email.  My coworker called me to say that my boss had came in and talked to her since I told him that she knew.  He said the company is behind me 100 percent and not to worry that my time off work will be covered.  That is a relief.  I have been so freaked out about letting people know.  It does feel better.  There are still other coworkers who will be difficult.  I was the same way, when my old supervisor told me she had breast cancer I started crying.  She told me I AM GOING TO BEAT THIS!  She did,  now I am in the same spot and I feel bad for crying when she told me.  That was 6 or 7 years ago, she has since retired.  Now I feel I need to call her up and apologize for doing that.  I was just so scared for her it was my first reaction.  Bless all of you.

Thanks for your reply.

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 08:52AM martygra wrote: Thank you all for your positive responses.  So many mixed emotions at this time.  I am sure you can all relate.  I went to work and talked to my boss this morning.  I told him I was really worried about telling people as I am freaked out enough on my own and I could not handle the shock and fear others may show me if I tell them.  He said he would tell people in our morning meeting and I said that would be alot easier for me.  I am not going to be able to hide it forever I am sure,  I just can't deal with breaking the news at this time.  I just can't seem to shake this I am abnormal feeling I have right now like I just want to hide.  Did any of you feel that way?  Hopefully that will subside.  My boss told me that I will probably have alot of people coming up to me and telling me they love me,  I said that is ok,  I may cry but I just can't deal with the shock and fear reaction.  Thank you all again.  XOXO

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 08:50PM martygra wrote: All I can say is I am so sorry for how you feel.  I know the feeling.  I feel like some sort of a freak just for having this breast cancer and it is none of our fault.  Don't even understand why I feel that way I just do.  Just so totally not fair.  Just going along minding your own business living your life and blamo hits you out of the blue.  Hoping for a day to be able to look back on all this and say thank God that is behind us.  Other ladies say that day will come, it is just hard to fathom right now.  Just know that you are not alone,  so many others feeling the same way.  Hugs
Posts.Title: And it keeps getting worse... Michele_T lhasamom

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2011 09:28AM martygra wrote: I just got my phone call on 9/6 telling me my biopsy was positive.  My dr. apt. is this Tuesday to find out what is going to go on.  My sister in law who is a breast cancer survivor is going with me.  I have been totally freaked out.  Dr. did mention on the phone might be chemo first to shrink the tumor.  That is all I know for now.   How do you ladies deal with this.  I cannot even seem to do the simplest things right now.  I am ashamed of myself for acting this way.  I work 40 hours a week at a job I have had for 33 years.  I have not told my employers yet.  I have to do that tomorrow.  I am pretty sure that I am going to cry and blubber like a baby when I do.  I have been feeling suicidal over this weekend.  Just don't know if I am going to be able to do this.  I have no small children.  I am 54 years old.  I feel for you women who do have little kids to take care of.  I can't even take care of myself right now. I just needed to talk to someone who has been or is there. Just feel so very very sad and scared. Bless you all.
Posts.Title: Just new-need advice jackiefoley jackiefoley

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2011 10:30AM martygra wrote: Thanks for your reply.  I also got the call at work.  I work in an office in a production plant.  My coworker was on vacation.  I could not break down as there would have been no one there to run the office,  it was the most horrible week.  I broke down the first day of my weekend.  I do have xanax which I had to take a couple of at work last week,  saved me from going off the deep end I think.  How are you doing now?  I just feel so horrible,  as I am sure anyone in this position can relate to.   6 years ago my supervisor at work went through this, she has since retired.  She seemed so strong and did not even hardly miss any work.  I don't know how in the heck she did it.  Were you able to work most of the time?  What helped you get through it?  Did you take any thing for your nerves?  Thank you so much.
Posts.Title: Just new-need advice jackiefoley jackiefoley

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2011 12:52PM martygra wrote: Caryn,  First off you are awesome!  I need to take some lessons from you on not falling apart.  I am independent, divorced twice, and bought my own home 10 years ago.   Still paying for it of course.  I have a very kind male roomate.  He is being so sweet to me.  He is like a family member to me and his family is much closer to me then my own family of 7, was 9 but two have died.  I feel really bad for dragging him down.  He has his own health issues, chronic heart disease, has had a triple by pass and a heart valve replacement.  I have him so bummed out I am worried about adding to his own troubles.  I told him I would not blame him if he left.  He is 70 and has been my dearest friend for 12 years.  He says he will not leave me.  You are all great.  Thanks so much for your help.  I hope to get my dignity back and plow through this.  I have not even been able to brush my teeth and take a shower yet today and it is almost 10:00 a.m.. I just wish I could get this out of my head. GRRRRRRRRRRRRR
Posts.Title: Just new-need advice jackiefoley jackiefoley

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2011 11:44AM martygra wrote: Hi Cindy,  I am in the same boat as you.  I had my biopsy 8/30, have not gotten the results yet.  I was hoping I would not hear before this 4 day holiday weekend and I did not so I still have hope it will be some wierd thing not cancer.  Everyone says but don't you want to know so if it is something you can get it taken care of!  I say yes but I am sure they are not going to do anything with me over this weekend so I can still be hopeful can't I!?!?  This whole ordeal started for me the last day of July when I found the lump.  Then a week later the trip to my womens dr. then the ultra sound the next week.  Radiologist wrote Rad4 on my report and sent it to my womens dr. who called me the next morning at work and told me to prepare for the worst, after saying that to me twice in the conversation I said what do you mean prepare for the worst a death sentence?  She says oh no I mean the C word.  Well when you already are worried you might have cancer and they tell you to prepare for the worst it scared the S--t out of me.  I was already thinking I needed to decide who I was going to give my 2 precious dogs to. To make matters worse my phone rang at 8:30 yesterday morning, caller ID said womens health center which is where my first appt. was with the dumb dr. who diagnosed me just from looking at the ultra sound report. I started shaking and answered the phone. they just wanted to know if I was going to come in for my lab tests, you know where they check your blood for sugar levels and all that stuff. Just about put me into the meltdown phase again. Grrr, I am sorry you are going through this along with all the other women in this big crazy world we live in.    Did you get your results yet? Praying for you and others.
Posts.Title: Scared CindyT Kimmer1975

Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2011 11:16AM martygra wrote: Wow!  I can't afford to be off work so am hoping I don't have to miss much.  I guess I will have to get through it, I don't have much choice. I am glad you are doing good now.  The idea of being bald is really bothering me.  Thanks for your words of encouragement.

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2011 08:24PM martygra wrote: Congratulations!  Thanks for letting all know,  it is nice to hear from the 80% I keep reading are found to be B9!  I am waiting to hear my results.
Posts.Title: My lab results are in apaige Lavender250

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2011 12:52PM martygra wrote: Thank you Trish,  You make my heart smile.  I just can't imagine having to feel depressed over this years after the treatment ends and you get to go about your regular life again.  When I read about the people that are still battling depression years later it makes me wonder sometimes if it is even worth getting the treatment, those times are getting fewer now but when I first started going through the tests and all back in August and I would read that it would really get me down.  Thanks so much for your positive post.
Posts.Title: Marking 8 years since... Trish03 CherylinOhio

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2011 03:18PM martygra wrote: Hi Deborah,  I just had my last of 4 sessions of Adriamycin/cytoxin on Friday.  I was scared to death before I started.  The morning before my first session I felt like I was going for a shot of death by lethal injection,  I must tell you that it has not any where near as my mind had told me it was going to be.  I have had no nause whatsover.  These are the problems I have had.  I was always constipated the day ofter treatment.  I have learned to take 2 stool softeners the night of treatment and that usually does the trick, if not I put 2 T of Milk of magnesia in about 4 oz of prune juice and that does the trick. I have had some problems sleeping so I will take 2 tylenol pm's before bed and sometime I take a Lorazepam.  My hair started to go on day 14, be prepared for that.  I had a wig lined up and went and got my hair cut short and directly started wearing the wig. My head was sore and itchy for about a week but now it is ok.  I have had a tender mouth, no actual sores but difficulty eating anything cruncy.  Taste buds not what they should be.  I rinse my mouth with the salt/soda/water mixture.  I use a super soft toothbrush and biotine toothpaste and mouth rinse.  My feet were sore on the bottoms for about 4 of 5 days after the third session but it went away and has not came back.  The tips of my fingers have been sore for a couple of weeks,  I would say about a 4 on a scale of 1-10 pain scale, helps to cut your finger nails short.  That is all the problems I have had.  I will be having my first session of taxol on 11/23 and am hoping it will go so well. I have not had any bone pain from the nuelesta shot that I have gotten the day after each chemo session. I did take claritin as I had read that it helped. I asked the chemo nurse about that and she said she had heard that also, she said it could not hurt. I do not know if that is why I have no bone pain or not.  I have not had to miss any work due to not feeling well from chemo I work Mon - Friday through Thursay 10 hour days 6:00 am to 4:30 pm. I am wishing you the best and I am sure you will find out that it is not as bad as your mind has been imaging it will be. Take care.
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last month and anxious about chemo starting DeborahK seacretgardn

Posts.Content: Sep 8, 2011 07:32AM martygra wrote: Many prayers for you.  I will be thinking of you Loula.
Posts.Title: Surgery this morning. LouLa DocBabs

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2011 06:13PM martygra wrote: Congratulations to you! I am so thankful to hear that you will be back to normal.  I was just diagnosed on 9/6/11 and I my biggest fear is not getting back to normal.  Some women say its a different kind of normal and I just want my old normal at least,  The more appreciative part sounds good,  I just don't like reading about the women who years later are still depressed and all that.  It scares me to think I will never feel at least as normal as I was before I found out I had this battle to fight.   Thank you so much for posting.
Posts.Title: Marking 8 years since... Trish03 CherylinOhio

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2011 03:09PM martygra wrote: I don't know what to say except that I am so sorry for your sadness and fear.  I will say a prayer for you that God will give you strength to get through this.
Posts.Title: Struggling Through Today lukejessesmom china

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2011 09:00PM martygra wrote: Hi Cindy,  Sounds like you are on your way to getting rid of it.  I was just told today that my biopsy showed it was cancer, that is all I know for now, will find out more Tuesday of next week.  Glad to hear that you are feeling better.  It is so very scary.   I am also post menopausal,  age 54.  Just long to be able to think of something else.  Best wishes to you.
Posts.Title: Fear CindyT jazz3000

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2011 03:58PM martygra wrote: Hi Cindy,  I am new here so do not know what your results mean.  I just had my biopsy done on last Tuesday so do not know anything yet.  I am sorry that your results were positive.  I was just sitting here myself wondering how to handle this fear myself,  feels like I am going off the deep end.  There is alot of women on this site who have gone through all kinds of treatments and I am sure they will be more then willing to help you out.  I don't know how people are expected to make these kind of decisions about things they know nothing about.  Its like well I never had cancer before how in the hell do I know what I should decide to do.  Some people tell you to take some sort of medication for the anxiety and fear.  I for one find the only time I am not afraid is when I am asleep, just wishing I could sleep and sleep and sleep.  So sorry for your results wishing you the best.
Posts.Title: Fear CindyT jazz3000
